description: Comprehensive test cases for Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System v2.1 calculator, covering zone-based scoring (PZ vs TZ), DCE upgrade rules, DWI upgrade rules, EPE/SVI staging, and all score combinations
references: Turkbey B, et al. Prostate Imaging Reporting and Data System Version 2.1: 2019 Update. Eur Urol. 2019;76(3):340-351
Weinreb JC, et al. PI-RADS Prostate Imaging - Reporting and Data System: 2015, Version 2. Eur Urol. 2016;69(1):16-40

testCases.description: Normal peripheral zone with DWI score 1 - no abnormality detected

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (1)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 1. Step 3: No upgrade criteria met. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 1.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 2 - PZ Assessment

testCases.description: Peripheral zone with DWI score 2 - linear/wedge-shaped hypointensity

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (2)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 2. Step 3: No upgrade criteria met. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 2.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 2 - PZ Assessment

testCases.description: Peripheral zone with DWI score 3 and negative DCE - remains PI-RADS 3

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (3)
expectedOutputs.Biopsy Recommendation: Individualized decision based on PSA density, prior biopsy, clinical factors

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 3. Step 3: DCE is negative, so no upgrade. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 3.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 8 - PZ DCE Upgrade Rule

testCases.testName: PZ PI-RADS 3 to 4 - DCE Upgrade Rule
testCases.description: Critical PZ upgrade rule: DWI 3 + positive DCE = PI-RADS 4

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: DWI score 3 upgraded to PI-RADS 4 due to positive DCE

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 3. Step 3: DCE is positive, triggering upgrade from 3 to 4. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 8 - PZ DCE Upgrade Rule: 'In PZ, positive DCE upgrades DWI 3 to PI-RADS 4'

testCases.description: Peripheral zone with DWI score 4 - focal markedly hypointense lesion <1.5cm

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 4 (markedly hypointense, <1.5cm). Step 3: Final PI-RADS = 4 (DCE upgrade only applies to DWI 3).
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 2 - PZ Assessment

testCases.description: Peripheral zone with DWI score 5 - markedly hypointense lesion >=1.5cm

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (5)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 5 (markedly hypointense, >=1.5cm). Step 3: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 2 - PZ Assessment, size threshold 1.5cm

testCases.description: PZ with DWI 3 but DCE not performed - cannot upgrade, remains 3

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (3)
expectedOutputs.Biopsy Recommendation: Individualized decision based on PSA density, prior biopsy, clinical factors
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: DCE not performed - cannot assess for upgrade from PI-RADS 3 to 4; Consider PSA density (>=0.15 ng/mL/cc favors biopsy), prior negative biopsy history, family history

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, so DWI is dominant sequence. Step 2: DWI score = 3. Step 3: DCE not performed, cannot assess upgrade. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 3 with clinical note.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Section on biparametric MRI (bpMRI) limitations

testCases.description: Normal transition zone with T2W score 1 - heterogeneous signal typical of BPH

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on T2W score (1)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 1. Step 3: DWI (1) is not > T2W (1), no upgrade. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 1.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 3 - TZ Assessment

testCases.description: Transition zone with T2W score 2 - circumscribed hypointense nodule (typical BPH)

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on T2W score (2)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 2. Step 3: DWI (2) is not > T2W (2), no upgrade. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 2.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 3 - TZ Assessment

testCases.description: Transition zone with T2W score 3, DWI score 3 - heterogeneous non-circumscribed

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on T2W score (3)
expectedOutputs.Biopsy Recommendation: Individualized decision based on PSA density, prior biopsy, clinical factors

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 3. Step 3: DWI (3) is not > T2W (3), no upgrade. Note: DCE does NOT upgrade TZ lesions. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 3.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 9 - TZ DWI Upgrade Rule (DCE not applicable for TZ upgrade)

testCases.testName: TZ PI-RADS 3 to 4 - DWI Upgrade Rule
testCases.description: Critical TZ upgrade rule: T2W 3 + DWI >=4 = PI-RADS 4

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: T2W score 3 upgraded to PI-RADS 4 due to DWI score 4

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 3. Step 3: DWI (4) > T2W (3), AND T2W = 3 AND DWI >= 4, so upgrade to 4. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 9 - TZ DWI Upgrade Rule: 'In TZ, if T2W = 3 and DWI >= 4, upgrade to PI-RADS 4'

testCases.description: TZ with T2W 3 and DWI 5 - DWI upgrades to PI-RADS 4

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: T2W score 3 upgraded to PI-RADS 4 due to DWI score 5

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 3. Step 3: DWI (5) > T2W (3), AND T2W = 3 AND DWI >= 4, so upgrade to 4 (not 5, capped at 4 for this rule). Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 9 - Note: DWI upgrade in TZ caps at category 4 for T2W 3 lesions

testCases.description: TZ with low T2W (2) but high DWI (4) - DWI takes precedence

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4) which exceeds T2W score (2)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 2. Step 3: DWI (4) > T2W (2), AND T2W < 3 AND DWI >= 4, so use DWI score. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 9 - TZ Assessment: when DWI >> T2W and DWI >= 4, DWI score may be used

testCases.description: Transition zone with T2W score 4 - lenticular circumscribed homogeneous <1.5cm

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on T2W score (4)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 4. Step 3: DWI (4) is not > T2W (4), no upgrade needed. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 3 - TZ Assessment

testCases.description: Transition zone with T2W score 5 - same as 4 but >=1.5cm OR EPE

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on T2W score (5)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, so T2W is dominant sequence. Step 2: T2W score = 5 (>=1.5cm or EPE). Step 3: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Table 3 - TZ Assessment, size threshold 1.5cm

testCases.description: Central zone lesion uses PZ scoring rules (DWI dominant)

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = CZ (Central Zone), which uses PZ criteria per PI-RADS v2.1. Step 2: DWI is dominant sequence. Step 3: DWI score = 4. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: 'The central zone... is assessed using PZ criteria'

testCases.description: Central zone with DWI 3 and positive DCE - upgrades like PZ

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: DWI score 3 upgraded to PI-RADS 4 due to positive DCE

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = CZ uses PZ criteria. Step 2: DWI is dominant, score = 3. Step 3: DCE positive triggers upgrade to 4. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: CZ uses PZ criteria including DCE upgrade rule

testCases.testName: Anterior Fibromuscular Stroma - Uses TZ Criteria
testCases.description: AFS lesion uses TZ scoring rules (T2W dominant)

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on T2W score (3)
expectedOutputs.Biopsy Recommendation: Individualized decision based on PSA density, prior biopsy, clinical factors

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = AFS (Anterior Fibromuscular Stroma), which uses TZ criteria per PI-RADS v2.1. Step 2: T2W is dominant sequence. Step 3: T2W score = 3. Step 4: DCE does NOT upgrade TZ-type lesions. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 3.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: 'The anterior fibromuscular stroma... is assessed using TZ criteria'

testCases.description: AFS with T2W 3 and DWI 4 - DWI upgrades like TZ

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: T2W score 3 upgraded to PI-RADS 4 due to DWI score 4

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = AFS uses TZ criteria. Step 2: T2W is dominant, score = 3. Step 3: DWI (4) > T2W (3), triggers upgrade to 4. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: AFS uses TZ criteria including DWI upgrade rule

testCases.description: Definite EPE upgrades any PI-RADS category to 5

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (3); Upgraded to PI-RADS 5 due to definite extraprostatic extension or SVI

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, DWI dominant. Step 2: DWI score = 3 (initial PI-RADS 3). Step 3: Definite EPE present. Step 4: EPE upgrades to PI-RADS 5. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 5 with T3a staging.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Section 3.3: 'Definite EPE... indicates stage T3a and upgrades the assessment category to PI-RADS 5'

testCases.description: Definite EPE upgrades PI-RADS 4 to 5

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4); Upgraded to PI-RADS 5 due to definite extraprostatic extension or SVI

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, DWI dominant. Step 2: DWI score = 4 (initial PI-RADS 4). Step 3: Definite EPE present. Step 4: EPE upgrades to PI-RADS 5. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Section 3.3: EPE criteria

testCases.description: Definite SVI upgrades any PI-RADS category to 5 (T3b staging)

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4); Upgraded to PI-RADS 5 due to definite extraprostatic extension or SVI

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, DWI dominant. Step 2: DWI score = 4. Step 3: Definite SVI present. Step 4: SVI upgrades to PI-RADS 5 and indicates T3b staging. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Section 3.4: 'Definite SVI... indicates stage T3b'

testCases.description: Both definite EPE and SVI present - both noted in staging

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (5); Upgraded to PI-RADS 5 due to definite extraprostatic extension or SVI
expectedOutputs.Staging Notes: Definite EPE present (>=T3a); Definite SVI present (T3b)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, DWI dominant. Step 2: DWI score = 5 (already PI-RADS 5). Step 3: Both EPE and SVI present. Step 4: Both staging notes recorded. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Sections 3.3-3.4: Combined staging notes

testCases.description: Suspected (not definite) EPE does not upgrade PI-RADS

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, DWI dominant. Step 2: DWI score = 4. Step 3: EPE is 'suspected' not 'definite' - no upgrade. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 4 with staging note.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: Only 'definite' EPE upgrades to category 5

testCases.description: Lesion at 1.4cm - remains score 4 per size criteria

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (4)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ. Step 2: DWI score = 4. Step 3: Size = 1.4cm (below 1.5cm threshold). Step 4: No size note displayed. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 4.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: Size threshold of 1.5cm differentiates score 4 from 5

testCases.description: Lesion exactly at 1.5cm threshold - qualifies for score 5

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (5)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ. Step 2: DWI score = 5. Step 3: Size = 1.5cm (meets threshold). Step 4: Size note displayed. Step 5: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: >=1.5cm with markedly hypointense ADC = score 5

testCases.testName: Discordant T2W and DWI in PZ
testCases.description: PZ with high T2W (5) but low DWI (2) - DWI still dominant in PZ

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (2)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ, DWI is always dominant regardless of T2W. Step 2: DWI score = 2 (despite T2W = 5). Step 3: DCE upgrade only applies to DWI 3. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 2.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: In PZ, DWI is dominant regardless of T2W findings

testCases.testName: Discordant T2W and DWI in TZ - Low T2W
testCases.description: TZ with low T2W (1) but high DWI (5) - DWI overrides

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (5) which exceeds T2W score (1)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ, T2W is dominant. Step 2: T2W score = 1. Step 3: DWI (5) >> T2W (1), AND DWI >= 4, so DWI takes precedence. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, Figure 9: When DWI significantly exceeds T2W in TZ, DWI may override

testCases.description: TZ with T2W 2 but DWI 5 - demonstrates DWI override for low T2W

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (5) which exceeds T2W score (2)

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = TZ. Step 2: T2W score = 2. Step 3: DWI (5) > T2W (2), AND T2W < 3, so DWI overrides. Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 5.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: In TZ, when T2W < 3 and DWI >= 4, DWI score is used

testCases.description: Error when zone is not selected

expectedOutputs.Error: Please select the anatomic zone and provide T2W and DWI scores to calculate PI-RADS category.

testCases.calculationSteps: Validation check: zone is empty. Return error message.
testCases.medicalReference: N/A - Validation case

expectedOutputs.Error: Please select the anatomic zone and provide T2W and DWI scores to calculate PI-RADS category.

testCases.calculationSteps: Validation check: t2w_score is empty. Return error message.
testCases.medicalReference: N/A - Validation case

testCases.description: Error when DWI score is not provided

expectedOutputs.Error: Please select the anatomic zone and provide T2W and DWI scores to calculate PI-RADS category.

testCases.calculationSteps: Validation check: dwi_score is empty. Return error message.
testCases.medicalReference: N/A - Validation case

testCases.description: All fields filled - comprehensive output verification

expectedOutputs.Scoring Logic: PI-RADS category based on DWI score (5)
expectedOutputs.Staging Notes: EPE suspected - requires clinical correlation; SVI suspected - requires clinical correlation
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: MRI-targeted biopsy (cognitive or software fusion) recommended over systematic biopsy alone

testCases.calculationSteps: Step 1: Zone = PZ. Step 2: DWI dominant, score = 5. Step 3: Suspected EPE/SVI noted but don't upgrade (only 'definite' does). Step 4: Final PI-RADS = 5 with clinical notes.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1, comprehensive assessment

testCases.description: Verify PI-RADS 4 includes MRI-targeted biopsy recommendation

expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: MRI-targeted biopsy (cognitive or software fusion) recommended over systematic biopsy alone

testCases.calculationSteps: PI-RADS 4 triggers clinical note about MRI-targeted biopsy being preferred over systematic biopsy.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: MRI-targeted biopsy recommendations based on PRECISION trial

testCases.description: Verify PI-RADS 3 includes PSA density and clinical factor guidance

expectedOutputs.Biopsy Recommendation: Individualized decision based on PSA density, prior biopsy, clinical factors
expectedOutputs.Clinical Notes: Consider PSA density (>=0.15 ng/mL/cc favors biopsy), prior negative biopsy history, family history

testCases.calculationSteps: PI-RADS 3 triggers clinical note about decision factors including PSA density threshold.
testCases.medicalReference: PI-RADS v2.1: PSA density >=0.15 ng/mL/cc favors biopsy for PI-RADS 3 lesions

peripheralZone.dceUpgradeRule: If DWI = 3 AND DCE = positive, upgrade to PI-RADS 4
peripheralZone.epeRule: If EPE = definite OR SVI = definite, upgrade to PI-RADS 5

dwiUpgradeRule.condition1: If T2W = 3 AND DWI >= 4, upgrade to PI-RADS 4
dwiUpgradeRule.condition2: If T2W < 3 AND DWI >= 4, use DWI score
dwiUpgradeRule.condition3: If DWI > T2W AND DWI >= 4, DWI may override

transitionZone.dceNote: DCE does NOT play a role in TZ upgrade decisions
transitionZone.epeRule: If EPE = definite OR SVI = definite, upgrade to PI-RADS 5

sizeThresholds.score4vs5: 1.5 cm - lesions >=1.5cm with appropriate features = score 5
sizeThresholds.note: Size alone does not determine PI-RADS category, but is a criterion for scores 4 vs 5

staging.upgradeTrigger: Only 'definite' (not 'suspected') EPE or SVI upgrades to PI-RADS 5

notes: PI-RADS v2.1 was published in 2019 as an update to PI-RADS v2 (2015)
Peripheral Zone (PZ) and Central Zone (CZ) use DWI as dominant sequence
Transition Zone (TZ) and Anterior Fibromuscular Stroma (AFS) use T2W as dominant sequence
DCE upgrade rule (3 to 4) ONLY applies to PZ/CZ, NOT to TZ/AFS
DWI upgrade rule for TZ: T2W 3 + DWI >=4 = PI-RADS 4
Only 'definite' EPE or SVI upgrades to PI-RADS 5, 'suspected' does not
1.5cm is the size threshold differentiating scores 4 and 5
Clinically significant cancer is defined as Gleason score >=7 (ISUP grade group >=2)
bpMRI (biparametric MRI without DCE) has specific limitations noted in clinical output
